Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre, below, part of two white bands; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes compares the sherd to the Tocra Type III chalices.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206-7, no. N16)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 303, no. 1124, pl. 154)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1181) (phase 2)
